bug.author: EFgit
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
st.date_input widget is unable to go before January 2000, e.g. 1999,1990, etc… It doesn’t matter if you use the dropdown box or the left arrow, because when it arrives in January 2000 the left arrow disappears. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Put a st.date_input in your app Try using arrows/or scroll in the dropdown menu before date: January 2000
You can actually set a date before January 2000 if you initialize it using value parameter, e.g. d = st.date_input('When's your birthday', datetime.date(1980, 7, 6)) But even in this case, you don't see the left arrow anymore only the right one, also the dropdown still only shows Januar 2000. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Use the arrows or scroll through the dropdown box to go at any date in the past (or at least till 1900). <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
As soon as you reach at January, 2000 the left arrow disappears and also the scroll ends. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
I don't know, because I haven't used it in the past. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.50.2 Python version: 3.7.3 Using venv OS version: ManjaroLinux 18.1.2 Browser version: Mozilla Firefox 70.0 (64-bit)/Google Chrome 72.0.3626.121 (Official Build) (64-bit)

comments.comment:
Baseweb's Datepicker is all kinds of broken. I've filed a bug against it here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/uber/baseweb/issues/2418>uber/baseweb#2418</denchmark-link>
We should reprioritize based on their response?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kantuni>@kantuni</denchmark-link> created a patch in Baseweb for this, here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/uber/baseweb/issues/2418>uber/baseweb#2418</denchmark-link>
We need to update to the latest Baseweb (and help make sure the patch gets merged). I'll put this ticket on hold until then.
Hi, this seems to be still broken in streamlit 0.55.0. Any chance to get it fixed ? Thanks !

Looks like the patch has been merged and we're on the latest Baseweb. The issue is fixed on the Baseweb site, but it requires passing in a minDate argument to the component that's lower than 2000/01/01 which looks to be the default. We need to handle minDate in Streamlit or lower the default value to something reasonable.
